titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

scopecontent.p: The collection consists primarily of music manuscripts. Materials include: printed and manuscript scores of compositions with words by Hoffmann von Fallersleben; printed scores by German composers, including Carl Schnabel and Eduard Hetz; a series of piano preludes by Robert Jacque Wilson, late 1940s, manuscript and printed; a manuscript of "Wanderer's Nachtlied II" by Paul Krummeich, 1946; manuscript scores by H. A. Clarke; and manuscript scores by William Stansfield. There is also a cabinet photograph of Richard Strauss and an 1819 letter from Benedict Nenninger to Wilhelm Speyer, in German.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
